# DataScannerViewController.QualityLevel

**Enumeration**

The possible quality levels that the scanner uses to find data.

## Declaration

```swift
enum QualityLevel
```

## Overview

The quality levels mostly impact the camera resolution.

## Identifying quality levels

- **DataScannerViewController.QualityLevel.balanced**: A quality level that’s between fast and accurate.
- **DataScannerViewController.QualityLevel.fast**: A quality level that prioritizes recognition speed over accuracy.
- **DataScannerViewController.QualityLevel.accurate**: A quality level that prioritizes recognition accuracy over speed.

## Configuring data scanners

- **delegate**: The delegate that handles user interaction with items recognized by the data scanner.
- **qualityLevel**: The resolution that the scanner uses to find data.
- **recognizesMultipleItems**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the scanner should identify all items in the live video.
- **isHighFrameRateTrackingEnabled**: A Boolean value that determines the frequency at which the scanner updates the geometry of recognized items.
- **isPinchToZoomEnabled**: A Boolean value that indicates whether people can use a two-finger pinch-to-zoom gesture.
- **isGuidanceEnabled**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the scanner provides help to a person when selecting items.
- **isHighlightingEnabled**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the scanner displays highlights around recognized items.

## Conforms To

- Copyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
